message.content: {"id": "41347", "title": "Bug 41347: CCombo fires defaultSelection on mouse list selection", "description": "When using a CCombo, it should not fire the defaultSelection event when an entry is selected from the dropdown list using the mouse. This behavior is inconsistent with standard Combos and can be confusing to users. The current behavior makes it difficult to distinguish between selecting an entry using the mouse and pressing Enter after typing in the text field of the CCombo.", "OB": "If you drop down the combo list using the mouse and then select an entry using the mouse, the CCombo fires a defaultSelection event. However, standard Combos do not exhibit this behavior.", "EB": "The CCombo should not fire the defaultSelection event when an entry is selected using the mouse from the dropdown list.", "SR": "Fix the CCombo so that it does not fire the defaultSelection event when an entry is selected using the mouse from the dropdown list."}

origin.input_prompt:
Your role is a senior software engineer, you are very good at analyzing and writing bug reports.
It is possible that the bug report may lack sufficient details in the OB, EB, and SR sections.  In such cases, your task is to infer the appropriate details based on the context and supplement the bug report to ensure it contains clear and complete OB/EB/SR statements.  Also, improve the wording of these statements for clarity where possible.
To facilitate this process, please provide your responses in JSON format as follows:
{"id": "", "title": "", "description": "", "OB": "", "EB": "", "SR": ""}
origin.input_content:
<BUG REPORT>
{'id': '41347', 'title': "Bug 41347CCombo shouldn't fire defaultSelection on mouse list selection", 'description': "Bug 41347CCombo shouldn't fire defaultSelection on mouse list selection It shouldn't do this. A typical user of a combobox would be vert surprised to have thedialog be dismissed just because the entry was selected. ", 'OB': "If you drop down the combo list using the mouse and then select an entry usingthe mouse, the CCombo fires a defaultSelection. Standard Combos won'tdo this.Because of this you can't tell the difference between just selecting an entryusing the mouse and hitting enter from the text field of the CCombo. ", 'EB': '', 'SR': ''}
